episodes.title: Explored Inside Abandoned Carriage House & Horse Stables Converted To Cult Member Dorm Rooms In MA
episodes.description:
This place is creepy. It's behind a former religious cult leader owned mansion which is also abandoned. It was most likely just a rich persons' mansion and a normal carriage house and stables at one time.

The cult leader was able to purchase and renovate it into dorm type living by brainwashing his followers into donating large sums of money. He would even try to have followers sell their homes and donate the money to him and live there.

One artist named Betsy Dovydenas donated 6.5 million dollars. She was a member from 1984 to 1985 and claimed she was brainwashed in the lawsuit. She was awarded a lesser amount of 5.5 million in 1987.

The religious cult went by the name "The Bible Speaks" and called itself a Christian religious group. It operated in Lenox Massachusetts from 1976 to 1987. It was run by Carl H. Stevens Jr. who also declared bankruptcy in 1987 and moved to Baltimore. He died in 2005.

Former members allege there was Mind Control practiced, Sexual Misconduct, Child Molestation, Fraud & Extortion.

The mansion was locked & boarded up so I couldn't go inside but i filmed the outside of it at the end of the video.

The Carriage house was a fun inside explore but creepy finding out what it was used for. One of the doors opened by itself although it was a very windy day it was spooky. 

I also noticed that one of the doors on one of the small rooms had a locking latch hook on the outside of the door to lock someone in - maybe a kid.

There were a couple dozen papers completely filled with handwritten bible quotes in another room. Was that someone being punished or was that part of the brainwashing technique?

I hope you enjoy the video. Thanks for watching. Please subscribe. 

Thank You to all my current subscribers.

Take Care...
